{{For|the municipalities named in his honour|José Félix Ribas Municipality (disambiguation){{!}}José Félix Ribas Municipality}} [[Image:Martin Tovar y Tovar 07.JPG|thumb|José Félix Ribas]] '''José Félix Ribas''' ({{IPA-es|xoˈse ˈfeliks ˈriβas}}; [[Caracas]], 19 September 1775 – [[Tucupido]], 31 January 1815), was a [[Venezuela]]n independence leader and [[hero]] of the [[Venezuelan War of Independence]].
==Early life==
Ribas was the last of eleven sons, born to a prominent [[Caracas]] family. In his early years, he received a quality education and attended the city's seminary. After finishing his studies, he began working in the agrarian sector. At the age of 21 he married María Josefa Palacios, the aunt of [[Simón Bolívar]]. He soon became interested in Republican ideals and sympathetic to the revolutionary independence movement.
Ribas became involved in the [[Conspiracy of 1808]], but was taken prisoner after its failure. In his defense, he stated that on the day of the action, he was just heading to a public square to spend time. Actually, Ribas was frequenting the square to meet with other republicans to plan an uprising. He was later freed by the authorities.
When the [[Supreme Junta|Revolution of 19 April 1810]] was taking place, it was reported that Ribas was seen travelling throughout the entire city, encouraging people to join-in the demonstrations against Spanish rule. In the aftermath he joined the interim government on April 25, taking charge of the municipality of Caracas.
==Military career==
Apart from his political functions in the interim government, and despite having no military background, Ribas was named Colonel of the Barlovento Battalion which he helped set up with his own funds. He also maintained some contact with [[Francisco de Miranda]], and offered him all possible support when Miranda arrived in the country. Along with other fellow Republicans, he became a member of the [[Sociedad Patriótica]] organized by [[Francisco de Miranda]], in contradistinction to the New Venezuelan Congress which was ruled mostly by the landed few. The Sociedad Patriótica was modeled after a French [[Jacobin Club]], encouraging the practice of oratory on equality of rights to all citizens.
During a brief period of Venezuelan independence (the [[Second Republic of Venezuela]] under the stewardship of Simón Bolívar), Ribas fought in numerous battles of the "[[Admirable Campaign|Campaña Admirable]]"; however the most crucial episode was the [[Battle of La Victoria (1814)|battle of ''La Victoria'']] (12 February 1814) in which he and his comrades succeeded in foiling the advance of [[José Tomás Boves]]'s formidable [[Royalist (Hispanic American Revolution)|royalist]] forces (commanded in this battle by proxy [[Francisco Tomás Morales]], while Boves recovered from wounds). Ribas won this victory with inexperienced troops, composed mainly of youths, students, and seminary candidates that Ribas has succeeded in recruiting. Ribas told his young soldiers, his charges, before a crucial battle that "We have no choice between victory or death, we must achieve victory" ("No podemos optar entre vencer o morir, es necesario vencer"). After many hours of fierce resistance, Republican reinforcements arrived under the command of [[Vicente Campo Elías]]. It is in honor of this episode of Venezuelan history that modern Venezuelan citizens now celebrate the "Día de la Juventud" ("Day of Youth"). each 12 February.
== Capture and death after Urica and Maturín ==
He fought vigorously in the [[Battle of Urica]] in which the republican forces lost but his royalist nemesis Boves was killed. After this battle, his forces assisted in offering a last desperate resistance to Morales at the [[Battle of Maturín]]; however this effort also was defeated. Ribas, together with a nephew and a faithful servant, was forced to flee from the victorious royalists. However, he was ultimately betrayed to the royalists by a slave. He was captured and executed by beheading. Ribas's lopped off head, after having been fried in cooking oil, was sent to [[Caracas]]. There, it was placed in public display within a small cage with the intention of demoralizing the patriots.
== Legacy == Almost two centuries later, Ribas' deeds were commemorated by the [[Hugo Chávez]] government when it named one of the [[Bolivarian Missions]] "[[Mission Ribas|Missión Ribas]]" in his honor. There are also two Venezuelan municipalities named after him, [[José Félix Ribas Municipality, Aragua]] state; and [[José Félix Ribas Municipality, Guárico|José Félix Ribas Municipality]], [[Guárico]] state.

{{multiple issues| {{confusing|date=August 2018}} {{more citations needed|date=August 2018}} {{rough translation|listed=yes|date=August 2018}} }} {{infobox person | name = Kakon Bibi | native_name = কাঁকন বিবি | native_name_lang = bn | birth_name = Kaket Hanchiata | image = | image_size = 200px | caption = | birth_date = 1915 (unverified)
Other sources give 1927/28 or 1931/32 | birth_place = [[Meghalaya]], [[India]] | nationality = Bangladeshi | death_date = {{death date|2018|3|21|df=y}} (age uncertain) | awards = [[Bir Protik]] | module = {{Infobox military person |honorific_prefix = |name = Military career |honorific_suffix = |image = |image_upright = |alt = |caption = |native_name = |native_name_lang = |birth_name = |other_name = |nickname = |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |placeofburial = |placeofburial_label = |placeofburial_coordinates = |allegiance = {{flagicon|Bangladesh}} [[Bangladesh]] |branch = [[Mukti Bahini]] |branch_label = Alliance |serviceyears = 1971 |serviceyears_label = Service year |rank = |rank_label = |servicenumber = |unit = |commands = |battles = [[Bangladesh liberation war]] |battles_label = |awards = [[File:Bir Protik.JPG|40px|]] [[Bir Protik]] |memorials = |spouse = |children = |relations = |laterwork = |signature = |signature_size = |signature_alt = |website = |module = }} }} '''Noorjahan Kakon Bibi''' [[Bir Protik|'''Bir Protik''']] ({{lang-bn|কাঁকন বিবি}}, {{lang-kha|Kaket Hanchiata}}; died 21 March 2018){{cite news |title=Bir Protik Kakon Bibi dies |url=http://m.risingbd.com/english/national/news/52564/Bir-Protik-Kakon-Bibi-dies |work=[[Risingbd.com]] |date=22 March 2018 |access-date=22 March 2018}} was an [[Indians in Bangladesh|Indian Bangladeshi]]{{cite news |title=Bangladesh War Liberation hero Bir Protik Kakon Bibi dies |url=https://bdnews24.com/bangladesh/2018/03/22/bangladesh-liberation-war-hero-bir-pratik-kakon-bibi-dies |date=22 March 2018 |access-date=22 March 2018}} [[freedom fighter]] and [[secret agent]] of the [[Bangladesh Liberation War]] of 1971. She was arrested and brutally tortured by the [[Pakistan army]]. She is one of two female freedom fighters honored with the Bir Protik award in 1996, the fourth highest honor in Bangladesh due to her gallant contribution in the liberation war.{{cite news |script-title=গুপ্তচর কাকন বিবি |trans-title=Spy Kakon Bibi |url=http://www.mzamin.com/details.php?mzamin=NTQzMzE= |newspaper=Manab Zamin |date=13 December 2012 |language=bn |access-date=22 March 2018}}{{cite news |title=Constitutional recognition of indigenous people demanded |url=http://archive.thedailystar.net/newDesign/story.php?nid=94844 |newspaper=[[The Daily Star (Bangladesh)|The Daily Star]] |date=29 June 2009 |access-date=22 March 2018}}{{cite news |script-title=কাকন বিবির গল্প |trans-title=Story of Kakon Bibi |url=http://oldsite.dailyjanakantha.com/news_view.php?nc=38&dd=2012-01-27&ni=84759 |newspaper=[[Janakantha]] |date=27 January 2012 |language=bn |access-date=22 March 2018}} ==Personal life== Noorjahan Kakon Bibi was born, as Kaket Hennyata (other sources state Kaket Hanchiata) in a [[Khasi people|Khasi]] family at Nayrai Khasia Palli, [[Meghalaya]], [[India]]. Her sister was married to a member of the border guards, She got married to Shaheed Ali of Dirai village in 1970. After her marriage, her name was changed to Noorjahan Begum but she was mostly known as Kakon Bibi. She gave birth to a baby girl Sakhina on 16 March 1971. Because of [[discrimination against girls in India]], her husband was displeased and they got separated. Later she was married to Abdul Majid Khan, and they had a son who died at birth Majid was living in EPR camp where he also worked. After two months, she brought Sakhina from her previous home. But she couldn't find her husband, Abdul Majid Khan, after returning. Hearing that Majid had been transferred to a camp of [[Dowarabazar Upazila]] she went there.{{cite news |script-title=বীরপ্রতীক উপাধির স্বীকৃতি চান কাকন বিবি |trans-title=Kakon Bibi wants to recognize the title of Bir |url=http://www.jugantor.com/old/bangla-face/2014/12/16/190261 |newspaper=Jugantor |date=16 December 2014 |language=bn |access-date=22 March 2018}} ==Liberation war== A war was happening in the Dowarabazar area when Kakon went to there to search for her husband. She went to Tengratilla camp. Their Pakistani Army captured her in a bunker and she faced inhuman physical and mental torture for many days. She left her hope for finding husband and joined Muktibahini (the [[guerrilla warfare|gerrila]] [[resistance movement]] formed by the [[Bangladesh Armed Forces|Bangladesh military]], paramilitary and civilians during the War of Liberation. Freedom fighter Rahmat Ali introduced her to sector five commander, [[Mir Shawkat Ali]]. Shawkat called Kakon Bibi his sister of religion. With his influence, she started working as a secret agent under a disguise of a beggar. In April 1971 Kakon Bibi was captured by the [[Razakar]]s while spying in [[Bangla bazar]] in the region of [[Dowarabazar Upazila]]. They tortured her immensely including burning with a hot iron rod. Sexual torture was also intensified. Later they took her to the Pakistani camp in Tengratilla. There, she told the Pakistani commander that she is the wife of Pakistani soldier Abdul Majid Khan and she came in search of him. The Pakistani commander believed her. Rather, she was proposed to work for the Pakistanis. She agreed and began to help freedom fighters providing information in a more effective way. This was primarily achieved through receiving an identification card from the Pakistani commander. With that ID card she started going to the Pakistani camp more often and with greater ease and supplied the freedom fighters with important information. Later Kakon took part in nearly 20 battlefronts. In November, she was engaged in a front war in Tengratilla where she was deeply injured. The injury marks were visible on her knee till her death. ==Death== Kakon Bibi was hospitalised in 2017 after a heart attack. She died of pneumonia at [[Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College|Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College and Hospital]] on 21 March 2018. At the time of her death, Kakon Bibi's age could not be verified. Reports range from 85{{cite web |url=http://1971archive.org/dt/stories/12/tale-of-legendary-freedom-fighter-kakon-bibi |title=Tale of Legendary Freedom Fighter Kakon Bibi |date=26 January 2017 |access-date=23 March 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171022080921/http://1971archive.org/dt/stories/12/tale-of-legendary-freedom-fighter-kakon-bibi |archive-date=22 October 2017}} or 90{{cite news |title=Kakon Bibi laid to rest |url=http://www.thedailystar.net/city/kakon-bibi-laid-rest-1552180 |date=23 March 2018 |access-date=23 March 2018}} to an age of 103.{{cite news |script-title=বীর মুক্তিযোদ্ধা কাঁকন বিবি আর নেই |trans-title=Bir Freedom Fighter Krabon BiBi is no longer |url=http://www.ekushey-tv.com/বীর-মুক্তিযোদ্ধা-কাঁকন-বিবি-আর-নেই/30353 |work=[[Ekushey Television]] |date=22 March 2018 |language=bn |access-date=22 March 2018}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Year of birth uncertain]] [[Category:2018 deaths]] [[Category:Deaths from pneumonia]] [[Category:Mukti Bahini]] [[Category:People from Sunamganj District]] [[Category:Women in war]]

{{Infobox military person |name=Karakoz Abdaliev |image=Abdaliev Karakozy.jpg |caption= |birth_date= 1908 |death_date= October 22, 1943 |birth_place= Chimkent Uyezd, [[Syr-Darya Oblast]], [[Russian Turkestan]], [[Russian Empire]] |death_place=near [[Melitopol]], [[Ukrainian SSR]] |placeofburial=south of [[Melitopol]], [[Ukraine]] |nickname= |allegiance={{USSR}} |branch=[[Red Army]] |serviceyears=1941 – October 22, 1943 |rank=[[Lieutenant]] |unit = [[126th Rifle Division (Soviet Union)|126th Rifle Division]] |commands = |battles =[[World War II]] *[[Battle of the Dnieper]] |awards = {{Hero of the Soviet Union}} {{Order of Lenin (medallion)}} }}
[[Lieutenant]] '''Karakoz Abdaliev''' ({{lang-ru|Каракозы Абдалиев}} (1908 – October 22, 1943) was a [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] soldier who was awarded the title of [[Hero of the Soviet Union]] posthumously in 1943 for his actions during the [[Battle of the Dnieper]]. He was reported to have killed 72 German soldiers and destroyed two tanks.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.warheroes.ru/hero/hero.asp?Hero_id=8902|title=Абдалиев Каракозы|website=www.warheroes.ru|access-date=2018-01-31}}</ref>
==Early life== Abdalev was born in a peasant family of [[Kazakhs|Kazakh]] ethnicity in Chimkent Uyezd, [[Syr-Darya Oblast]], in [[Russian Turkestan]] in the [[Russian Empire]] (present-day [[Tole Bi District]], [[Kazakhstan]]) in 1908. He attended school and graduated in 1924, after the [[Russian Revolution (1917)|Russian Revolution]] of 1917. From 1924 until 1941 he worked on the Taldybulak [[Kolkhoz]].<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3">{{Cite book|url=http://www.az-libr.ru/index.htm?Persons&014/7ceb5256/index|title=Герои Советского Союза: Краткий биографический словарь|last=|first=|publisher=Voenizdat|year=1987|isbn=|editor-last=Shkadov|editor-first=Ivan|volume=1 Abaev-Lubitsch|location=Moscow|pages=15|language=Russian|trans-title=Heroes of the Soviet Union: A Brief Biographical Dictionary}}</ref>
==Eastern Front (World War II)== He joined the [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union]] in 1940, and was called up from the [[Kazakh SSR]] in 1941. He fought on the [[Eastern Front (World War II)]] from 1942. Abdaliev became a lieutenant and platoon leader in the 690th Rifle Regiment of the [[126th Rifle Division (Soviet Union)|126th Rifle Division]], part of the [[51st Army (Russia)|51st Army]].<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3" />
==Death and award== Abdaliev fought in the Battle of the Dnieper in late 1943. In fighting near [[Melitopol]], in modern-day [[Ukraine]], on 21–22 October 1943 he was reported by the Presidium of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union to have cleared 17 houses occupied by the [[Wehrmacht]] in addition to having destroyed 23 [[machine-gun|machine-gun posts]], two tanks and killed more than 72 German soldiers. However, he was killed in the fighting and posthumously awarded the title of Hero of the Soviet Union and the [[Order of Lenin]] for "exemplary performance of command assignments at the front against the Nazi invaders and for displaying courage and heroism".<ref>Hero of the Soviet Union citation, available online at [https://pamyat-naroda.ru/heroes/podvig-chelovek_nagrazhdenie150000026/ pamyat-naroda.ru]</ref> He was buried south of Melitopol.<ref name=":1" /><ref>Irretrievable loss report, available online at [https://pamyat-naroda.ru/heroes/memorial-chelovek_donesenie3137643/ pamyat-naroda.ru]</ref><ref name=":3" />
==Posthumous honours== In addition to his HSU medal, a bust of him was erected in Fogolevo, [[South Kazakhstan Province]]. A street is named after him in [[Melitopol]] with a plaque remembering his achievements.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3" />
==See also== * [[Eastern Front (World War II)]] * [[51st Army (Russia)]]

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Marianne Horinko |office = [[Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency]]
{{small|Acting}} |president = [[George W. Bush]] |term_start = July 14, 2003 |term_end = November 5, 2003 |predecessor = [[Christine Todd Whitman]] |successor = [[Mike Leavitt]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1961|5|10}} |birth_place = [[Everett, Massachusetts|Everett]], [[Massachusetts]], [[United States|U.S.]] |death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] |education = [[University of Maryland, College Park]] {{small|([[Bachelor of Science|BS]])}}
[[Georgetown University]] {{small|([[Juris Doctor|JD]])}} }} '''Marianne Lamont Horinko''' served as Acting Administrator of the [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]] (EPA) from July 14, 2003 to November 5, 2003 during the first term of [[President of the United States|President]] [[George W. Bush]]. Prior to this appointment Horinko was Assistant Administrator for the Office of Solid Waste and Emergency Response (OSWER) at EPA, having been confirmed by the [[United States Senate|U.S. Senate]] on October 1, 2001. She continued on as Assistant Administrator until June 1, 2004. Horinko, an author and speaker on environmental cleanup policy, is currently the President of the Horinko Group, an environmental consulting firm focused on sustainability. She made an unsuccessful bid for a [[Virginia]] state Senate seat in late 2009. ==Education== Horinko graduated from the [[University of Maryland, College Park]] with a [[Bachelor of Science]] in [[analytical chemistry]] in 1982 and from [[Georgetown University Law Center]] with a [[Juris Doctor|J.D.]] in 1986.[https://archive.is/20070707175156/http://www.epa.gov/history/admin/oswer/horinko.htm Marianne Horinko EPA Biography], March 25, 2004. Retrieved 2010-07-08. ==Career and civic service== Horinko was an attorney at [[Morgan, Lewis & Bockius]], involved in the areas of pesticides and hazardous waste counseling, [[Clean Water Act]] and [[Superfund]] litigation, and environmental audits in connection with business transactions. She was responsible for both the Superfund Settlements Project and the Information Network for Superfund Settlements, a policy group of over 120 companies, law firms, and other organizations headquartered in ML&B's Washington office. During the [[George H. W. Bush]] Administration, Horinko was Attorney Advisor to Don Clay, EPA's Assistant Administrator for Solid Waste and Emergency Response. In that capacity she was responsible for [[Resource Conservation and Recovery Act]] (RCRA) regulatory issues and Superfund reauthorization. Clay was a career EPA employee who was elevated to the assistant administrator position by [[William K. Reilly]].[http://www.epa.gov/history/publications/reilly/11.htm "Top EPA personnel"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061002171703/http://epa.gov/history/publications/reilly/11.htm |date=2006-10-02 }} segment of EPA oral history interview with W.K. Reilly, July 29, 1993. Retrieved 2010-07-08. After EPA, Horinko was president of Clay Associates, Inc., a national environmental policy consulting firm. She was responsible for launching the RCRA Policy Forum, a membership organization composed of federal and state governments, environmental groups, [[Capitol Hill, Washington, D.C.|Capitol Hill]] staff, and industries interested in furthering constructive dialogue to improve the nation's waste programs. Through July, 1998, Don Clay was serving as president of Don Clay Associates Inc., "a Washington, D.C.-based public policy consulting firm devoted to solid and hazardous waste regulation and environmental cleanup issues." At that time, he took the position of director of regulatory affairs with [[Koch Industries]], one of the companies DCA had been advising, to be based in Washington.[http://www.allbusiness.com/government/government-bodies-offices/6853131-1.html "Former EPA Assistant Administrator Joins Koch Industries; Don Clay to Help Further Environmental..."], ''Business Wire'', July 8, 1998. Retrieved 2010-07-08. Back at EPA during her tenure as Assistant Administrator, Horinko refocused the goals of her office around five major priorities: Homeland Security/Emergency Response; One Cleanup Program; Land Revitalization; Energy Recovery, Recycling & Waste Minimization; a Retail Environmental Initiative (the Resource Conservation Challenge) and Workforce Development. Following the [[September 11 attacks]] in 2001, she spent her first few months at EPA in the role of assisting in environmental cleanup activities at [[Ground zero#World Trade Center|Ground Zero]] in lower [[Manhattan]], [[the Pentagon]] in [[Washington, D.C.]], and the [[2001 anthrax attacks|anthrax attack]] at the [[Hart Senate Office Building]]. In 2003, as national program manager, Horinko oversaw EPA's response to the [[Space Shuttle Columbia disaster|Space Shuttle ''Columbia'' disaster]]. The [[Brownfield land|Brownfields]] program was signed into law by President Bush in 2002. Under her leadership, the budget for the Brownfields program was doubled. In mid-May, 2004, in the leadup to the [[United States presidential election, 2004|2004 election]], Horinko was questioned in the media relative to an EPA rule about industrial laundry and toxic waste, on the one hand, and gifts to the Bush campaign, particularly by [[Cintas Corporation]] founder and [[Bush Pioneer]] fundraiser [[Richard T. Farmer]], on the other. Cintas, headquartered in the greater [[Cincinnati]] area in the [[United States presidential election, 2004#Battleground states|electoral-battleground state of Ohio]], was then the biggest company in the industrial laundry business. "In a summary of the rule, the EPA said it would improve 'clarity and consistency' of regulation, 'provide regulatory relief, and save affected facilities over $30 million'" by allowing industrial shop towels to be washed in water that would then go into municipal waste-water treatment systems. At the time, "3 billion of the [towels were being used to] sop up more than 100,000 tons of hazardous solvents such as [[benzene]], [[xylene]], [[toluene]] and [[methyl ethyl ketone]]" per year. Horinko "said Farmer's campaign contributions had nothing to do with the agency's decision," and Farmer likewise denied he had lobbied EPA directly or contributed to the campaign for the purpose of affecting the EPA ruling. However, Farmer said in the report that he did complain about the rule to [[Ohio]] [[Republican Party of the United States|Republican]] [[U.S. Senate|Sen.]] [[George V. Voinovich]] and [[House of Representatives of the United States|Rep.]] [[Rob Portman]], a fellow Bush Pioneer and chairman of Bush's campaign in Ohio. And, "[a]bout the same time in 2002 that Farmer was making his calls and the [[Trade association|trade groups]] were contacting members of Congress, he made a major contribution. On March 19, 2002, Farmer gave $250,000 to the [[National Republican Congressional Committee]]."[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A31714-2004May16.html "The Bush Money Machine: An Industry Gets Its Way: Fundraiser Denies Link Between Money, Access: EPA Rule on Hazardous Waste Favored Ohio Businessman Who Is a Big GOP Donor"] by [[James V. Grimaldi]] and [[Thomas B. Edsall]]; database editor Sarah Cohen and researcher Alice Crites contributed to the report; ''Washington Post'', May 17, 2004, Page A01. Retrieved 2010-07-08. On June 1, Horinko left the agency. Horinko made a bid for the Republican nomination for the [[Virginia]] state Senate seat, 37th District, [[Fairfax County]], Sully District, to replace then-Attorney General-Elect [[Ken Cuccinelli]] (R) in a special election.[http://www.connectionnewspapers.com/article.asp?article=335429&paper=62&cat=110 "GOP To Nominate Senator Candidate"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100207031224/http://connectionnewspapers.com/article.asp?article=335429&paper=62&cat=110 |date=2010-02-07 }}, letter to the editor by Ajay N. Laheri, ''connectionnewspapers.com'', "Centerview Southern Edition", November 25, 2009. Retrieved 2010-07-08. Steve Hunt, who won the nomination and whom Horinko then endorsed,[http://www.connectionnewspapers.com/article.asp?article=336172&paper=62&cat=110 "Vote Steve Hunt in the 37th"]{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, letter to the editor by M. Horinko, ''connectionnewspapers.com'', "Centerview Southern Edition", December 16, 2009. Retrieved 2010-07-08. ultimately lost a close race in early January, 2010, to [[David W. Marsden]] (D-Fairfax), a result which "def[ied] recent voting trends that saw several Northern Virginia Republicans win big in November."[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/01/12/AR2010011203717.html "Democrat wins Va. Senate race"], by Derek Kravitz, ''Washington Post'', January 13, 2010 7:51 AM. Retrieved 2010-07-08. Horinko is currently president of the Horinko Group, a Washington-based environmental consulting firm.[http://www.thehorinkogroup.org The Horinko Group website] ==Personal life== {{BLP unsourced section|date=January 2017}} Horinko has two children and lives in Chantilly, Virginia. She resumed use of her maiden name, Marianne Maccini, in 2012. She is active in the lectors ministry at St. Timothy Parish in Chantilly, serves as food coordinator for the Chantilly High School Choral Boosters, and serves as President of the Chantilly High School PTSA. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20100515202642/http://mariannehorinko.com/ Marianne Horinko: Making a difference] website. "Welcome: New website is coming soon! - Staff"; "Paid for by and Authorized by Friends of Marianne Horinko." Link reviewed 2010-07-08. {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before=[[Christine Todd Whitman]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency]]

{{confusing|date=August 2018}} The question of whether the [[historical Jesus|historical]] [[Jesus]] was in good [[mental health]] has been explored by multiple psychologists, philosophers, historians, and writers.
The first to openly question Jesus' sanity was French [[psychologist]] {{ill|Charles Binet-Sanglé|fr}}, the chief physician of [[Paris]] and author of the book ''La Folie de Jésus''.{{cite book |last=Binet-Sanglé |first=Charles |title=La folie de Jésus |publisher=A. Maloine |location=Paris |year=1908-1915 |language=fr |volume=1–4 |oclc = 4560820 }}{{cite magazine |last=Havis |first=Don |title=An Inquiry into the Mental Health of Jesus: Was He Crazy? |magazine=Secular Nation |publisher=[[Atheist Alliance International|Atheist Alliance Inc.]] |publication-place=Minneapolis |date=April–June 2001 |url=http://sfatheists.blogspot.com/2003/07/inquiry-into-mental-health-of-jesus.html |access-date=September 5, 2018 |issn=1530-308X}}
This view finds both supporters and opponents. ==Opinions challenging the sanity of Jesus== Charles Binet-Sanglé diagnosed Jesus as suffering from "religious paranoia":{{cite journal |last=Gettis |first=Alan |title=The Jesus delusion: A theoretical and phenomenological look |journal=[[Journal of Religion and Health]] |publisher=[[Springer Science+Business Media|Springer]] |volume=26 |issue=2 |date=June 1987 |pages=131-136 |doi=10.1007/BF01533683 |url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/27505915?seq=2#metadata_info_tab_contents |access-date=September 7, 2018 |issn=1573-6571 }}
In short, the nature of the hallucinations of Jesus, as they are described in the orthodox Gospels, permits us to conclude that the founder of Christian religion was afflicted with religious paranoia. (vol. 2, p. 393)
His view was shared by the New York [[psychiatrist]] [[William Hirsch]] who, in 1912, published his study "Religion and Civilization – Conclusions of a Psychiatrist",Hirsh, William, ''Religion and Civilization – Conclusions of a Psychiatrist'', Truth Seeker, New York 1912 enumerating a number of Jesus' mentally aberrant behaviours. Hirsch agreed with Binet-Sanglé in that Jesus had been afflicted with hallucinations, and pointed to his "megalomania, which mounted ceaselessly and immeasurably". Hirsch concluded that Jesus was "paranoid" – pure and simple, adding that:
But Christ offers in every respect an absolutely typical picture of a wellknown mental disease. All that we know of him corresponds so exactly to the clinical aspect of paranoia, that it is hardly conceivable how anybody at all acquainted with mental disorders, can entertain the slightest doubt as to the correctness of the diagnosis. (p. 103)
Jesus' mental health was also questioned by the British psychiatrists [[William Sargant]]{{cite journal |last = Sargant |first = William |title = The movement in psychiatry away from the philosophical |journal = [[The Times]] |page = 14 |date = 22 August 1974 |issn = 0140-0460 |quote =  Perhaps, even earlier, Jesus Christ might simply have returned to his carpentry following the use of modern [psychiatric] treatments.  }} and [[Raj Persaud]],{{cite web |url = https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/health-a-madman-can-look-a-lot-like-a-messiah-there-is-no-easy-way-for-cult-followers-to-tell-if-1457692.html |title = Health: A madman can look a lot like a messiah: There is no easy way for cult followers to tell if their leader is sane, says Raj Persaud |website = The Independent |accessdate = 2018-10-25 |last = Persaud |first = Raj |date = 27 April 1993 |quote =  Two thousand years ago Jesus received a crown of thorns. Today the Messianic have electro-convulsive therapy. }} a number of psychologists of the psychoanalytic orientation, e.g., Georges Berguer in his study "Quelques traits de la vie de Jésus au point de vue psychologique et psychanalytique".Georges Berguer, ''Quelques traits de la vie de Jésus: au point de vue psychologique et psychanalytique'', Edition Atar, Genève–Paris 1920 The Gospel of Mark (Mark 3:21) reports the opinion of members of Jesus' family who believe that Jesus "is beside himself". Some psychiatrists and writers explain that they saw Jesus as mad, insane.{{cite journal |last=Murray |first=Evan D. |last2=Cunningham |first2=Miles G. |last3=Price |first3=Bruce H. |title=The Role of Psychotic Disorders in Religious History Considered |journal=Journal of Neuropsychiatry and Clinical Neurosciences |publisher=[[American Psychiatric Association]] |volume=24 |issue=4 |date=September 2011 |pages=410–426 |doi=10.1176/appi.neuropsych.11090214 |cid= |url=https://neuro.psychiatryonline.org/doi/full/10.1176/appi.neuropsych.11090214 |access-date=2018-11-01 |issn=1545-7222 |quote=Mark 3:21 confirms a occasion where Jesus' friends and family viewed him as mad or "beside himself." }}{{cite book |last=Hirsch |first=William |title=Religion and Civilization – Conclusion of a Psychiatrist |publisher=Truth Seeker |location=New York |date=1912 |page=135 |quote=That the other members of his own family considered him insane, is said quite plainly, for the openly declare, "He is beside himself." }}{{cite book |last=Kashmar |first=gene |title=All the obscenities in the Bible |publisher=Kas-Mark Publishing Co. |location=Brooklyn Center, MN |date=1995 |page=157 |quote=He was thought to be insane by his own family and neighbors in 'when his friends heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself ... (Mark 3:21-22 – The Greek ''existemi'' translated beside himself, actually means insane and witless), The Greek word ''ho para'' translated friends, also means family. }}
And when his friends heard [of it], they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.[[Webster's Revision|Webster Bible]]
[[Władysław Witwicki]], a rationalist philosopher and psychologist, in the comments to his own translation of the Gospels of [[Gospel of Matthew|Matthew]] and [[Gospel of Mark|Mark]] ("{{ill|Dobra Nowina według Mateusza i Marka|pl}}"){{cite book |last=Witwicki |first=Władysław |title=Dobra Nowina według Mateusza i Marka = The Good News according to Matthew and Mark |publisher=Państwowe Wydawnictwo Naukowe |location=Warszawa |year=1958 |language=pl |oclc=681830910 }} attributed to Jesus the [[subjectivism]], increased sense of his own power and superiority over others, [[egocentrism]] and the tendency to subjugate other people,{{cite book |last=Szmyd |first=Jan |title=Psychologiczny obraz religijności i mistyki: z badań psychologów polskich = Psychological picture of religiousness and mysticism: from the research of the Polish psychologists |publisher=Wydawn. Naukowe WSP |location=Kraków |year=1996 |language=pl |page=197 |isbn=978-8-3868-4154-7 }} as well as difficulties communicating with the outside world and [[Dissociative identity disorder|multiple personality disorder]], which made him a [[Schizothymia|schizothymic]] or even [[Schizophrenia|schizophrenic]] type (according to the [[Ernst Kretschmer]] [[Personality type|typology]]).{{Cite journal |last=Citlak |first=Amadeusz |title=Psychobiography of Jesus Christ in view of Władysław Witwicki's theory of cratism |journal=Journal for Perspectives of Economic Political and Social Integration |publisher=Scientific Society KUL |volume=21 |issue=1-2 |year=2015 |pages=155-184 |doi=10.2478/pepsi-2015-0007 |issn=2300-0945 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.racjonalista.pl/kk.php/s,5828 |title=Jezus jako egocentryczny schizotymik |last=Jarzyńska |first=Karina |date=2008-04-10 |website=Racjonalista |publisher=Fundacja Wolnej Myśli |language=pl |access-date=2018-08-23}} In 1998–2000 [[Poles|Pole]] Leszek Nowak (born 1962)Not to be confused with Polish philosopher and lawyer [[Leszek Nowak]] (1943–2009) also from Poznań. from [[Poznań]] authored a study in which, based on his own history of [[religious delusion]] of mission and overvalued ideas, and information communicated in the Gospels, made an attempt at reconstructing Jesus' psycheLeszek Nowak, [https://web.archive.org/web/20160514125307/http://www.opracowanie.eu/index_2.htm Prywatna Witryna Internetowa Leszka Nowaka] at [[Internet Archive]] (in Polish) with the view of [[Portraits of the historical Jesus#Apocalyptic prophet|Jesus as apocalyptic prophet]],Analysis of fragments of the New Testament books for Jesus as apocalyptic prophet: Leszek Nowak, [https://web.archive.org/web/20160523101437/http://www.opracowanie.eu/pomylka_2.htm "A great mistake and disappointment of early Christianity"] at [[Internet Archive]] (in Polish) taking into account the hypothesis of "suicide by proxy".Leszek Nowak, [https://web.archive.org/web/20160706022513/http://www.opracowanie.eu/prowokator.htm "Prowokator" ("Instigator")] at [[Internet Archive]] (in Polish) He does so in chapters containing, in sequence, an analysis of character traits of the "savior of mankind", a description of the possible course of events from the period of Jesus' public activity, a [[Naturalism (philosophy)|naturalistic]] explanation of [[Miracles of Jesus|miracles]]. In 2011, a team of psychiatrists, [[Behaviorism|behavioral psychologists]], [[neurologists]] and [[Neuropsychiatry|neuropsychiatrists]] from the [[Harvard Medical School]] published a research which suggested the development of a new diagnostic category of psychiatric disorders related to religious delusion and [[hyperreligiosity]].{{cite journal |last=Murray |first=Evan D. |last2=Cunningham |first2=Miles G. |last3=Price |first3=Bruce H. |title=The Role of Psychotic Disorders in Religious History Considered |journal=Journal of Neuropsychiatry and Clinical Neurosciences |publisher=[[American Psychiatric Association]] |volume=24 |issue=4 |date=September 2011 |pages=410–426 |doi=10.1176/appi.neuropsych.11090214 |cid= |url=https://neuro.psychiatryonline.org/doi/full/10.1176/appi.neuropsych.11090214 |access-date=September 5, 2018 |issn=1545-7222 }} They compared the thought and behavior of the most important figures in the [[Bible]] ([[Abraham]], [[Moses]], Jesus Christ and [[Paul of Tarsus|Paul]]) with patients affected by mental disorders related to the [[Spectrum disorder#Psychosis|psychotic spectrum]] using different clusters of disorders and diagnostic criteria ([[DSM-IV-TR]]), and concluded that these Biblical figures "may have had psychotic symptoms that contributed inspiration for their revelations", such as schizophrenia, [[schizoaffective disorder]], [[Bipolar disorder|manic depression]], [[delusional disorder]], [[Grandiose delusions|delusions of grandeur]], [[Auditory hallucination|auditory]]-[[visual hallucination]]s, [[paranoia]], [[Geschwind syndrome]] and abnormal experiences associated with [[temporal lobe epilepsy]] (TLE). The authors suggest that Jesus sought to condemn him to death ("suicide by proxy"). ==Opinions defending the sanity of Jesus== The opinions of William Hirsch, Charles Binet-Sanglé and others questioning Jesus' mental health were in turn challenged by [[Albert Schweitzer]] in his doctoral thesis entitled ''The Psychiatric Study of Jesus: Exposition and Criticism''{{cite book |last=Schweitzer |first=Albert |translator-last=Joy |translator-first=Charles R. |title=The Psychiatric Study of Jesus: Exposition and Criticism |publisher=Peter Smith |location=Gloucester, Mass |year=1975 |isbn=0844628948 }} (''Die psychiatrische Beurteilung Jesu: Darstellung und Kritik'', 1913){{cite book |last=Schweitzer |first=Albert |title=Die psychiatrische Beurteilung Jesu: Darstellung und Kritik |publisher=J.C.B. Mohr (Paul Siebeck) |location=Tübingen |year=1913 |language=de |lccn=13021072 |oclc=5903262 }} and by psychiatrist Walter Bundy in his 1922 book ''The psychic health of Jesus''.Walter E. Bundy, ''The Psychic Health of Jesus'', The Macmillan Company, New York 1922 The mental health of Jesus is defended by psychiatrists Olivier Quentin Hyder,{{Cite journal |last=Hyder |first=Olivier Quentin |title=On the Mental Health of Jesus Christ |journal=Journal of Psychology and Theology |publisher=[[Biola University]] |volume=5 |issue=1 |date=1977-12-01 |pages=3-12 |doi=10.1177/009164717700500101 |issn=0091-6471 }} also by Pablo Martinez and [[Andrew Sims (psychiatrist)|Andrew Sims]] in their book ''Mad or God? Jesus: The healthiest mind of all'' (2018).Pablo Martinez, Andrew Sims, ''Mad or God? Jesus: The healthiest mind of all'' InterVarsity Press, Westmont 2018 {{ISBN|978-1-783-59606-5}}{{cite web |url=https://www.christiantoday.com/article/mad-or-god-a-senior-psychiatrist-on-the-mental-health-of-jesus/129999.htm |title=Mad or God? A senior psychiatrist on the mental health of Jesus |last=Sims |first=Andrew |date=2018-07-17 |website=Christian News on Christian Today |publisher=[[Christian Today]] |access-date=2018-08-23}} Also, [[Christian apologetics|Christian apologists]], such as [[Josh McDowell]]{{cite book |last=McDowell |first=Josh |chapter=Lord, Liar, or Lunatic? |title=More Than a Carpenter |publisher=Living Books |location=Wheaton, Illinois |year=1977 |pages=22-32 |isbn=978-0-8423-4552-1 }} and [[Lee Strobel]],{{cite book |last=Strobel |first=Lee |chapter=The Psychological Evidence |title=The Case for Christ |publisher=Zondervan |location=Grand Rapids, Michigan |year=2013 |pages=154-166 |isbn=978-0-3103-3930-4 }} take up the subject of Jesus' sanity defense. ==See also== * [[Criticism of Jesus]] * [[God complex]] * [[Grandiose delusions]] * [[Jerusalem syndrome]] * [[Lewis's trilemma]] * [[Messiah complex]] * [[Portraits of the historical Jesus]] * [[Religious delusion]] * [[Retrospective diagnosis]] ==Notes== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{cite web |url=https://archive.org/details/religionandcivi00hirsgoog |title=Religion and Civilization: The Conclusions of a Psychiatrist (full text) |last=Hirsch |first=William |date=1912 |website= Internet Archive |publisher=Truth Seeker Co |access-date=2018-08-23}} * {{cite web |url=https://archive.org/details/psychichealthofj00bund |title=The psychic health of Jesus (full text) |last=Bundy |first=Walter |date=1921 |website= Internet Archive |publisher=Macmillan Company|access-date=2018-08-23}} [[Category:Jesus]] [[Category:Mental health]] [[Category:Health by individual|Jesus]]

{{good article}} {{Infobox scientist |name =Myrtle Bachelder |image =Bachelder1942.jpg |image_size =200px |caption = |birth_date = March 13, 1908 |birth_place = [[Orange, Massachusetts]] |death_date = {{death date and age|1997|05|22|1908|03|13}} |death_place = [[Chicago|Chicago, Illinois]] |residence = |citizenship = |nationality = American |ethnicity = |field = [[Metallurgy]]
[[Radiochemistry]] |work_institutions = [[University of Chicago]], [[Los Alamos National Laboratory]] |known_for = Chemistry of uranium and rare earth elements |influences = |influenced = |signature =}} '''Myrtle Claire Bachelder''' (March 13, 1908 – May 22, 1997) was an American chemist and [[Women's Army Corps]] officer, who is noted for her secret work on the [[Manhattan Project]] atomic bomb program, and for the development of techniques in the chemistry of metals. ==Early life and career== Myrtle C. Bachelder was born on March 13, 1908, in [[Orange, Massachusetts]]. She earned a bachelor of science degree from [[Middlebury College]] in 1930, and became a high school science teacher and athletics coach in [[South Hadley, Massachusetts|South Hadley Falls, Massachusetts]]. She received her master of education degree from [[Boston University]].{{sfn|Bell|1993|p=29}}{{cite news |url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/1997-05-26/news/9705260114_1_manhattan-project-atom-bomb |newspaper=[[Chicago Tribune]] |title=Myrtle C. Bachelder |date=May 26, 1997 |accessdate=October 12, 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://www.mocavo.com/records/SSDI/2cbf0af365190dae4c19869ab1db6244 |title=Myrtle Bachelder |publisher=Mocavo |accessdate=October 12, 2013}} ==World War II: the atomic bomb== During [[World War II]], Bachelder enlisted in the [[Women's Army Corps]] (WAC) in November 1942, at the [[Springfield, Massachusetts]] headquarters. After spending time in training at military bases in several U.S. states, she received orders assigning her to the Company 'D' WAC Detachment of the [[Manhattan District]], [[United States Army Corps of Engineers]]. Her secret assignment was to lead a group of 15 to 20 women from the WAC, stationed in [[Des Moines, Iowa]], to [[Fort Sill|Fort Sill, Oklahoma]], and from there to [[Santa Fe, New Mexico]]. She and the women under her command arrived at [[Los Alamos, New Mexico]] on October 21, 1943.{{sfn|Bell|1993|p=29}}{{sfn|Howes|Herzenber|2003|pp=149-150}} "Manhattan" was the code name for the special military division dedicated to developing an atomic weapon. In [[Los Alamos National Laboratory|the clandestine laboratory]] at the remote Los Alamos desert site, Bachelder was responsible for the analysis of the [[spectroscopy]] of [[Isotopes of uranium|uranium isotopes]]. Since the [[uranium-235]] isotope is [[fissile]], whereas the [[uranium-238]] isotope is not, Bachelder's role in the project was a crucial task: to ensure the purity of the sub-critical material, and therefore the [[nuclear explosion]], of the world's first atomic bombs.{{sfn|Howes|Herzenber|2003|pp=149-150}} [[File:bachelder1946.jpg|thumb|right|Bachelder (center) at Los Alamos in 1946, with Captain Arlene Scheidenhelm, Director of WAC, Manhattan District (left), and First Lieutenant Marguerite Carrera, Commanding Officer, WAC Los Alamos detachment (right)]] These methods were used during the preparation of [[plutonium-239]], the fissile material used in the construction of the atomic bomb for the [[Trinity (nuclear test)|Trinity nuclear test]], on July 16, 1945. Analogous methods were used for the uranium weapon, code-named "[[Little Boy]]", which destroyed [[Hiroshima]], Japan on August 6, 1945, and for the plutonium bomb which [[Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki|destroyed Nagasaki, Japan]] on August 9, 1945, leading to the [[Japanese surrender]]. The secret program was under the general direction of [[J. Robert Oppenheimer]], whom Bachelder described as: {{quote|A "pencil and paper man", immersed in physics theory, who was more than a little amazed by the Los Alamos lab machinery. Bachelder recalled Oppenheimer standing in front of her lab's most important and expensive instrument punching buttons at random ... He asked "What does this do?" Then he'd punch another button ... He might have wrecked the machine if he hadn't finally been persuaded to leave it alone."Los Alamos Aide Recalls Dawn of Atomic Age". Brett Staples, [[Chicago Sun-Times]], November 19, 1984.}} ==Contribution to post-war developments in nuclear energy== The conclusion of the Second World War was also the dawning of a new "Atomic Age", in which the peacetime potential of nuclear energy began to be explored. Bachelder was among the scientists who opposed the May-Johnson Bill of October 1945, a Congressional bill proposed by the [[Interim Committee]], which would have maintained military control over nuclear research. The bill was defeated in Congress and superseded by the [[Atomic Energy Act of 1946|McMahon Atomic Energy Act]]. In January 1947, the newly formed [[United States Atomic Energy Commission|Atomic Energy Commission]] approved the declassification of 270 previously secret documents. These included discoveries related to [[X-radiation]] and purification of [[uranium ore]]s, which had been made by Bachelder during the course of the war effort. At this time, the rarity and importance of Bachelder's achievements as a [[Women in science|woman in science]] were also acknowledged."Atomic Boiler Hints Now Off Secret List, Women Among Authors". [[Howard W. Blakeslee]], Associated Press, January 31, 1947.{{cite web |url=http://digitalcommons.unl.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1209&context=usdeptcommercepub |title=American and British Atomic Energy Reports |first=O. Willard |last=Holloway |publisher=[[University of Nebraska–Lincoln]] |date=February 1948 |accessdate=April 15, 2014}} ==Scientific research and later career== After leaving the Army, Bachelder became a research chemist at the [[University of Chicago]], where the first self-sustaining nuclear reaction had been achieved in 1942. [[Nobel Prize|Nobel Laureate]] [[James Franck]] had been Director of the Chemistry Division of the [[Metallurgical Laboratory]] during the earlier phases of the Manhattan Project. Bachelder joined the University's Institute for the Study of Metals (renamed as the [[James Franck Institute]] in 1967), and she conducted further research in metallochemistry.{{cite journal |first=M.C. |last=Bachelder |first2=P M. |last2=Sparrow |title=Determination of Antimony in Indium Antimonide |journal=[[Analytical Chemistry (journal)|Analytical Chemistry]] |volume=29 |issue=1 |pages=149–150 |doi=10.1021/ac60121a043 |issn=0003-2700 |date=January 1957}}{{cite journal |first=M.C. |last=Bachelder |title=Effect of Constituent Materials upon Spectrographic Measurement of Seven Impurity Elements. |journal=[[Analytical Chemistry (journal)|Analytical Chemistry]] |volume=21 |issue=11 |pages=1366–1369 |date=November 1949 |doi=10.1021/ac60035a018}}{{cite journal |first=Myrtle C. |last=Bachelder |title=A diagnostic test on the mastery of chemical calculations. [[Journal of Chemical Education]] |volume=25 |issue=4 |pages=217 |date=April 1948 |issn=0021-9584 |doi=10.1021/ed025p217|bibcode=1948JChEd..25..217B }} Among other achievements, Bachelder developed methods for the purification of the rare elements [[tellurium]] and [[indium]]. Other aspects of her broad scientific expertise found application in the field of [[Maritime archaeology|marine archaeology]], when she determined the chemical composition of brass cannons found in the [[Aegean Sea]] on sunken ships. She also made contributions to [[astrochemistry]], when [[NASA]] asked her to analyze the chemistry of [[Moon rock]]s which had been collected from the Moon's surface during the [[Apollo program|Apollo missions]] from 1969 to 1972. Bachelder retired from the Franck Institute in 1973, and was subsequently active as an official of the [[AARP|American Association of Retired Persons]] (AARP). She died in Chicago on May 22, 1997. ==Reflections== Bachelder believed that her role in the development of the atomic bomb, and the subsequent use of atomic weapons against Japan, had been justified in order to end the Second World War and to avoid greater loss of life that would have been entailed in a U.S. land invasion and extended conflict with Japan. Later, during the period of the [[Strategic Arms Limitation Talks]], Bachelder stated that, although she supported nuclear arms control: {{quote|Opponents of nuclear weapons should resist the urge to take the 1940s bomb-building effort out of its proper historical context — "One cannot pull that activity out of that time, set it down in the 1980s, and pass judgement."}} ==Notes== {{reflist|30em}} ==References== * {{cite book |first=Iris Y. |last=Bell |title=Los Alamos WAACs/WACs: World War II, 1943–1946 |publisher=Coastal Printing |location=Sarasota, Florida |year=1993 |isbn=0-9637321-1-0 |ref=harv }} * {{cite book |first=Ruth H. |last=Howes |first2=Caroline L. |last2=Herzenber |title=Their Day in the Sun: Women of the Manhattan Project |publisher=Temple University |location=Philadelphia |year=2003 |isbn=0-585-38881-4 |ref=harv}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bachelder, Myrtle}} [[Category:1908 births]] [[Category:1997 deaths]] [[Category:20th-century women scientists]] [[Category:20th-century American chemists]] [[Category:AARP people]] [[Category:American women chemists]] [[Category:20th-century American educators]] [[Category:Boston University alumni]] [[Category:Manhattan Project people]] [[Category:Middlebury College alumni]] [[Category:Scientists from Chicago]] [[Category:People from Orange, Massachusetts]] [[Category:United States Army officers]] [[Category:University of Chicago faculty]] [[Category:Nuclear weapons scientists and engineers]] [[Category:American women in World War II]] [[Category:Women in technology]] [[Category:Women in the United States Army]]

{{BLP sources|date=June 2014}} {{Infobox person |name=Omar bin Laden |birth_date={{birth date and age|1981|3|1}}[http://www.akhbarak.net/articles/23932577-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D9%82%D8%A7%D9%84-%D9%85%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%B5%D8%AF%D8%B1-%D9%82%D8%B5%D8%A9-%D9%86%D8%AC%D9%84-%D8%A3%D8%B3%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%A9-%D8%A8%D9%86-%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%86 قصة نجل أسامة بن لادن «المُدلل»: التقى زوجته عند الأهرامات ودخل مستشفى الأمراض العقلية] |birth_place= [[Sulaqan, Qom|Sulaqan]], [[Iran]] |death_date= |death_place= |parents=[[Osama bin Laden]]
[[Personal life of Osama bin Laden|Najwa Ghanem]] |relatives=[[Abdallah bin Laden]] (brother)
[[Mohammed bin Awad bin Laden]] (grandfather)
[[Hamida al-Attas]] (grandmother) |spouse=Jane Felix-Browne |occupation=[[General contractor|Contractor]], [[Businessperson|businessman]] }} '''Omar bin Osama bin Mohammed bin Awad bin Laden''' ({{lang-ar|عمر بن أسامة بن محمد بن عوض بن لادن}}, ''ʿUmar bin ʾUsāmah bin Muḥammad bin ʿAwaḍ bin Lādin''; born 1981), better known as '''Omar bin Laden''', is one of the sons of [[Osama bin Laden]] and his first wife and first cousin [[Najwa Ghanem]]{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/08/20/AR2007082000980_3.html|title=Bin Laden Son Plays Key Role in Al Qaeda | work=The Washington Post | first1=Douglas | last1=Farah | first2=Dana | last2=Priest | date=2003-10-14 | accessdate=2010-05-20}} ''[title refers to [[Saad bin Laden]] ]'' (see [[Bin Laden family]]). He is the fourth-eldest son{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/uk/article2056380.ece|title=Briton marries bin Laden’s son|date=2007-07-11|author=David Brown | work=The Times | location=London}} among 20 children of Osama bin Laden.{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/meast/01/18/binladen.son.ap/index.html?eref=rss_world|title= Bin Laden's braided peacenik son on a mission|date=2008-01-18 | work=CNN}} {{Dead link|date=August 2010|bot=RjwilmsiBot}} Older reports have described Omar and his brother [[Abdallah bin Laden]] as nephews or cousins of Osama bin Laden.{{cite web|url=http://www.cooperativeresearch.org/entity.jsp?entity=omar_bin_laden|title=Profile:Omar bin Laden|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080306065255/http://www.cooperativeresearch.org/entity.jsp?entity=omar_bin_laden|archivedate=2008-03-06|df=}} ==Childhood== Bin Laden was born the grandson of [[Mohammed bin Awad bin Laden]], the founder of one of the wealthiest non-royal families in Saudi Arabia,{{cite web|url=http://www.macleans.ca/article.jsp?content=20070319_103225_103225|title=Happy 50th, Osama: More than five years since 9/11, bin Laden, at mid-life, terrorizes us still|author=Michael Petrou|date=2007-03-19|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120527192942/http://www.macleans.ca/article.jsp?content=20070319_103225_103225|archivedate=2012-05-27|df=}} and the son of [[Osama bin Laden]], whose partisan activities shaped his childhood. Bin Laden accompanied his father on his exile to [[Sudan]] from 1991 to 1996, and then to [[Afghanistan]] after that.{{cite web|url=https://www.bismarcktribune.com/articles/2008/01/17/ap/international/d8u7uoi00.txt |title=Bin Laden Son Wants to Be Pe Activist |publisher=Bismarck Tribune |author=Paul Schemm |date=2008-01-17 }}{{dead link|date=January 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} He said that he trained in [[al-Qaeda]] camps beginning at the age of 14, but after training with al-Qaeda for six years and sharing a house with al-Qaeda's second-in-command [[Ayman al-Zawahiri]], he left al-Qaeda in 2000 because he did not want to be associated with killing civilians and his father Osama did not object.{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/meast/01/21/binladen.son/index.html|title=Bin Laden's son to father: Change your ways|author=Aneesh Raman|date=2008-01-21|publisher=CNN}}{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/main.jhtml?xml=/news/2008/01/22/wosama122.xml|title= Osama bin Laden's son asks 'find another way'|author=Tom Leonard|publisher=Telegraph.co.uk|date=2008-01-23|location=London}}{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/GMA/story?id=4168151&page=1|title=Bin Laden's Son Wants to Make Up for Father's 'Mistake'|author=Nick Watt|date=2008-01-21|publisher=ABC News}} In 2010, Omar bin Laden told [[ABC News]] that Osama had severely beaten him when he was a child for smiling too widely.[http://abcnews.go.com/Health/MindMoodNews/omar-bin-laden-mental-illness-caused-genes-stress/story?id=11624890&singlePage=true Omar Bin Laden: Mental Illness Caused by Genes or Stress? - ABC News] ==Post-9/11== Bin Laden ran his own company in [[Jeddah]] prior to 2006 as a contractor and scrap metal dealer. Jeddah, a major city and important transit port for Saudi Arabia, is the site of the headquarters of the [[Saudi Binladen Group]] and has been reported to be "truly" ruled by [[Bakr bin Laden]].{{cite web|author = Georg Mascolo and Erich Follath|title = Osama's Road to Riches and Terror|date=2005-06-06|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/spiegel/0,1518,359690,00.html}} ===Marriage to Zaina Mohamed Al-Sabah=== Omar married Jane Felix-Browne, who also goes by the name Zaina Mohamed Al-Sabah, a parish councillor from [[Moulton, Cheshire|Moulton]], near [[Northwich]] in [[Cheshire]] in the [[United Kingdom]], on September 15, 2006.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/merseyside/6292072.stm|title=Councillor weds Bin Laden's son|work=[[BBC News Online]]|date=2007-07-11|accessdate=2007-07-11}} The marriage was conducted in September 2006 in Islamic ceremonies in both Egypt and Saudi Arabia, after which the couple spent a few months together in Jeddah before Zaina returned to Britain for several weeks.{{cite web|url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/19706669/|title=U.K. divorcee reportedly marries bin Laden son| date= 2007-07-11}}[http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b008h48b BBC One - Mr and Mrs Bin Laden] It has been reported that Felix-Browne met bin Laden while she was undergoing treatment for [[multiple sclerosis]].{{cite news| url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/news/world/2007-07-11-osama-marriage_N.htm | work=USA Today | title=British woman says she wed Osama's son | date=2007-07-11}}{{cite web|url=http://despardes.com/NewsExplorer/2007/20070712-bin-laden-marries.html|title=Brit bin Laden "Bahu" Raises Eyebrows}} They met on a horseback ride at the [[Giza pyramids]] in [[Egypt]]. She is his second wife and 24 years older than he is, with five grandchildren. She was aware when she married Omar that he had been married and divorced, with a two-year-old son. After their wedding, Al-Sabah described the stress of bin Laden's family background: "Omar is wary of everyone. He is constantly watching people who he feels might be following him. Not without reason he is fearful of cameras. He is the son of Osama. But when we are together he forgets his life." The couple announced their divorce in September 2007, which was said to be in response to threats to their "lives and liberty" from two unspecified sources known to them in Saudi Arabia. At the time, Al-Sabah said she did not regard herself as divorced and that as the divorce was done under duress did not have legal standing under [[Sharia]] law.{{cite news|title= Briton to divorce bin Laden's son|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/merseyside/7003047.stm|work=[[BBC News Online]]|date=2007-09-18|accessdate=2007-09-18}} After two weeks, Zaina and Omar decided not to part. In January 2008,{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-507873/Bin-Ladens-son-wants-visa--grandmother-bride-live-Cheshire-surrogate-baby.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=Bin Laden's son wants a visa - so he and his grandmother bride can live in Cheshire and have a surrogate baby | date=2008-01-13}} bin Laden applied for a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[European Economic Area Family Permit|spousal immigration visa]] which would have permitted him to reside indefinitely at his wife's home in [[Moulton, Cheshire]], a process which required him to provide original documentation of his divorce from his first wife. The couple stated their desire to have a child using a [[surrogate mother]].{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/story/0,23599,23046270-401,00.html|title=Bin Laden's son applies for British visa|date=2008-01-14 | work=The Daily Telegraph}} One report stated the visa application was denied because Omar failed to provide his father's permanent address.{{cite web|url=https://cbs2chicago.com/watercooler/Osama.bin.Laden.2.286421.html |title=British Divorcee Marries Son Of Osama Bin Laden |publisher=CBS |date=2007-07-11 }}{{dead link|date=January 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} However, a later report by ''[[The Times]]'' of Omar's appeal stated that the visa had been denied by an entry clearance officer at the UK embassy in Cairo because Omar's entry would cause "considerable public concern." The officer was quoted, "I note that statements made during recent media interviews indicate evidence of continuing loyalty to your father, and your presence in the UK could, therefore, cause considerable public concern." This written statement was shown to [[The Associated Press]] by the couple's legal firm, but Britain's [[Home Office]] declined to comment to the press on an individual case. In April 2008,{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-563042/Bin-Ladens-son-plans-legal-challenge-battle-UK-visa.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=Bin Laden's son plans legal challenge to battle for UK visa | date=2008-04-30}} bin Laden and Al-Sabah said they planned to appeal the ruling, calling it "unjust and arbitrary", stating that Al-Sabah requires medical attention in Britain and that her appeal to live with him in Saudi Arabia could take years to process. As of April 2008, bin Laden has a house in Cairo. In April 2010, bin Laden was denied a visa to promote his book ''[[Osama bin Laden: A Family Portrait]]'' in France and elsewhere in Europe. Specifically, the countries of the [[Schengen Area|Schengen zone]], a block of 25 nations across Europe including Germany, France and Spain, rejected his request for a visa.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/04/16/world/europe/16briefs-francebrf.html | work=The New York Times | first=Steven | last=Erlanger | title=France: Bin Laden Son Is Denied Visa | date=2010-04-15}}[http://www.myfoxtampabay.com/story/18048686/bin-ladens-son-denied-visa-for-european-book-tour Bin Laden's Son Denied Visa for European Book Tour - FOX 13 News] In July 2010, Felix-Browne told the media that bin Laden suffers from [[bipolar disorder]] and that he was in a [[Qatar]]i mental institution after [[Auditory hallucination|hearing voices]].{{cite news| url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/features/3047072/Omar-bin-Ladens-wife-on-why-they-split-up.html | location=London | work=The Sun | first=Jenna | last=Sloan | title=Omar bin Laden’s wife on why they split up – The Sun –Features}}{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1293277/Bin-Ladens-son-wife-Zaina-split-heard-Osamas-voice-head.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=Bin Laden's son and British wife split after he heard 'Osama's voice in his head' | date=2010-07-09}} Felix-Browne told the media that when bin Laden returned to the UK, Felix-Browne told him she wanted a divorce. As of 2015, Omar and Zaina have been married for 9 years and are living in an undisclosed country. All previous talk of divorce was publicized under duress and threats to their lives and their families lives.{{Citation needed|date = December 2015}} However, Omar bin Laden's divorce allegations were confirmed by Qatar's Gulf News with the report that a disagreement about the adoption of a surrogate child led to the dissolution of his second marriage.[http://gulfnews.com/news/gulf/qatar/exclusive-omar-bin-laden-divorces-second-wife-1.649494 "Exclusive: Omar Bin Laden divorces second wife"]. ''Gulf News QATAR''. Retrieved 2 June 2017. ===North African horse race=== [[File:Dakar traces mauritanie.jpg|thumb|[[Dakar Rally]] track through the [[Mauritania]]n [[Sahara]], 2005]] In January 2008, an [[Associated Press]] interview in [[Cairo]] featured bin Laden with [[cornrows]] and a black leather biker jacket promoting a {{convert|3000|mi|km|sing=on}} horse race for peace across North Africa.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailycomet.com/article/20080117/API/801170791|title=Bin Laden Son Wants to Be Peace Activist}} [[PETA]] president [[Ingrid E. Newkirk]] called for the cancellation of the race in an "urgent letter" from the organization, predicting that the gruelling race would lead to fatalities among the horses.{{cite web|url=http://www.khaleejtimes.com/DisplayArticle.asp?xfile=data/middleeast/2008/February/middleeast_February43.xml§ion=middleeast|title=PETA urges Laden’s son to cancel horse race|date=2008-02-04|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080628161824/http://www.khaleejtimes.com/DisplayArticle.asp?xfile=data%2Fmiddleeast%2F2008%2FFebruary%2Fmiddleeast_February43.xml§ion=middleeast|archivedate=2008-06-28|df=}}{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/uk/article3314629.ece|title=People: Kylie Minogue, James Blunt, Emma Thompson | work=The Times | location=London | date=2008-02-06 | accessdate=2010-05-20}} (''Collection of news shorts'') Omar described the race as an equine counterpart to the cancelled 2008 [[Dakar rally|Paris-Dakar car rally]], saying, "I heard the rally was stopped because of al-Qaida. I don't think they are going to stop me."{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,23073535-663,00.html|title=Omar Osama bin Laden organising horse race for peace | work=Herald Sun | first=Paul | last=Schemm | date=2008-01-19}} The race was canceled after the killings of four French tourists near [[Aleg]], [[Mauritania]] on [[Christmas Eve]] 2007.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/7159420.stm|title=Tourists shot dead in Mauritania|publisher=BBC|date=2007-12-24}} Following the murders race organizers received threats directly from heavily armed and organized groups linked to al-Qaeda, which led them to cancel the race on January 4, 2008, and soon after to plan the 2009 event for South America.{{cite web|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/rpm/news/story?seriesId=99&id=3180745&campaign=rss&source=ESPNHeadlines|title=Terror threat leads to cancellation of Dakar Rally}}{{cite web|url=http://www.speedtv.com/articles/auto/rally/42490/|title=Dakar Rally to Relocate to South America?|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080119170257/http://www.speedtv.com/articles/auto/rally/42490/|archivedate=2008-01-19|df=}} Police in [[Guinea-Bissau]] said that two of five men arrested for the crime on January 11, 2008, admitted their involvement with al-Qaeda.{{cite web|url=http://www.alertnet.org/thenews/newsdesk/L12305244.htm|title=Bissau extradites al Qaeda suspects to Mauritania}} ===Relationship to his father and al-Qaeda=== Omar said that his father felt that he was just trying to defend the Islamic world, and that his father was not a terrorist "because history tells you he's not". In an interview with [[ABC News]], he said, "My father is a very kind man. And he very sorry when he did something like 11th September." Osama ordered the attacks "Because he believes if he put two buildings down, maybe some people, little will die, but millions other will (be) save(d). He believed that. ... I believe he did wrong". In a January 21, 2008, [[CNN]] interview, he said "I try and say to my father: 'Try to find another way to help or find your goal. This bomb, these weapons, it's not good to use them on anybody". Regarding the September 11 attacks, he said, "I don't think 9/11 was right personally, but it happened. I don't think ... [the war] in Vietnam was right. I don't think what's going on in Palestine is right. I don't think what's going on in Iraq is right. If we make what is right and not right, we will make a very big list." Bin Laden stated that he had not been in contact with his father since leaving Afghanistan in 2000.{{cite news|url=http://www.nypost.com/seven/01182008/news/worldnews/bin_laden_son__i_am_for_peace_618930.htm |title=Bin Laden son: I am for peace |publisher=New York Post |date=2008-01-18 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080120111906/http://www.nypost.com/seven/01182008/news/worldnews/bin_laden_son__i_am_for_peace_618930.htm |archivedate=January 20, 2008 }} He said, "The last time I saw my father was in 2000, 2001. I was in Saudi Arabia and felt a terrible sorrow for all the victims [of the September 11 attacks]", "My father has a kind heart", and "I do not believe my father is dead, otherwise I would have known it; the world would have known it."{{cite web|url=http://www.news24.com/News24/World/News/0,,2-10-1462_2264941,00.html|title=Bin Laden wants to meet pope|date=2008-02-05|access-date=2008-11-12|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081122121101/http://www.news24.com/News24/World/News/0,,2-10-1462_2264941,00.html|archive-date=2008-11-22|dead-url=yes|df=}} When asked whether he would tell the Americans if he found out where his father was living, he said with a smile, "Actually, I would hide him. Because he is my father." According to ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'', Omar has stated a desire to become an "ambassador of peace" between Muslims and the West.{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/quotes/0,26174,1704818,00.html|title=Friday, Jan. 18, 2008 - Quotes of the Day | work=Time | accessdate=2010-05-20|date=2008-01-18}} Omar said that his father offered a truce to Europe in a 2004 videotape and a conditional truce with the United States in a [[19 January 2006 Osama bin Laden tape|2006 videotape]]. "My father is asking for a truce but I don't think there is any government (that) respects him. At the same time they do not respect him, why everywhere in the world, they want to fight him? There is a contradiction."{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/StoryPage/StoryPage.aspx?id=9fa22d77-2c70-4303-98e4-8051f9fe560b&ParentID=077ccdc8-c902-4dca-916a-a8e2c7e797e2&&Headline=Osama's+son+wants+to+be+a+'peace+ambassador'|title=Osama's son wants to be peace ambassador between West and Muslims}}{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The truces offered in these [[videos of Osama bin Laden]] were promptly rejected at the time.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/3627775.stm|date=2004-04-15|title=UK 'Bin Laden' offers Europe truce|publisher=BBC}}{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2004/WORLD/asiapcf/04/15/binladen.tape/index.html|title=Europe: No deal with bin Laden|publisher=CNN|date=2004-04-15 | accessdate=2010-05-20}}{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2006/US/01/19/binladen.tape/index.html|title=U.S. rejects bin Laden tape's 'truce' offer|publisher=CNN|date=2006-01-20 | accessdate=2010-05-20}} After arriving in [[Rome]] from [[Switzerland]] amid heavy security on February 2, 2008, bin Laden said in a television interview that night "I would very much like to meet the [[Pope]] in [[St. Peter's Basilica|Saint Peter's]], but I have been told that it is not easy." ===Asylum petitions=== On November 3, 2008, [[Spain]]'s Interior Ministry, upon recommendation by the [[United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees]] denied, for "insufficient evidence of danger or threat to [his] life", Omar's [[Right of asylum|political asylum]] petition, after he was refused a UK visa. Omar had 24 hours to appeal, after he made his claim at Madrid's [[Barajas International Airport]] upon a stopover on a flight from [[Cairo, Egypt]] to [[Casablanca, Morocco]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7712224.stm news.bbc.co.uk, Bin Laden son asylum bid rejected][https://www.nytimes.com/2008/11/06/world/europe/06briefs-ASYLUMDENIED_BRF.html nytimes.com, Spain: Asylum Denied to One of bin Laden’s Sons][http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/europe/11/05/osama.son.spain/?iref=mpstoryview edition.cnn.com, Bin Laden son loses asylum plea] Bin Laden and his wife arrived in [[Doha]], [[Qatar]] (where, as a Saudi citizen with a Saudi passport, he would have right of entry), on November 9, 2008, after deportation by Egypt per its denial of their entry. Omar filed another British visa petition in 2008.[http://africa.reuters.com/wire/news/usnL9718792.html africa.reuters.com, Bin Laden son, rejected by Egypt, arrives in Qatar]{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}[http://english.chosun.com/w21data/html/news/200811/200811100005.html english.chosun.com, Egypt Refuses Entry to Bin Laden's Son]{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}[http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/afp_world/view/388702/1/.html www.channelnewsasia.com, Osama bin Laden's son in Qatar after being deported from Egypt] ===Book=== Bin Laden and his mother [[Najwa bin Laden]] published a book authored in late October 2009, titled ''[[Growing Up bin Laden]]''. According to media coverage, the book details that "the kids grew up in Saudi Arabia, Sudan, and Afghanistan without laughter or toys, were routinely beaten, and lost their pets to painful death from poison gas experiments by their father's fighters." It states that Osama bin Laden tried to persuade his son to volunteer for suicide missions and exposed him to dangerous conditions visiting training camps in Afghanistan and sending him to the front lines of the [[War in Afghanistan (1978–present)|Afghan civil war]]. The book describes the family living in [[Jeddah]] without air conditioning or refrigeration, treating [[asthma]] with [[honeycomb]]s and onions, and eventually moving to stone huts in [[Tora Bora]] without electricity or running water in 1996. Subsequent correspondence with the Associated Press indicated that 25 bin Laden family members had moved to Iran, following U.S. involvement in Afghanistan.{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1932318,00.html|title=Growing Up bin Laden: Osama's Son Speaks|publisher=Time Magazine|date=2009-10-07|author=Andrew Lee Butters}}{{cite news|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/news/international/item_FotvaRLEtYyNGoPTTlcLwK|title=Tales from the Bin Laden clan:Wife and son bare secrets of terror kingpin|date=2009-10-11|author=[[Susannah Cahalan]]|publisher=New York Post}}{{cite web|url=http://www.3news.co.nz/Osama-bin-Ladens-family-parenting-exposed-in-sons-book/tabid/417/articleID/136255/Default.aspx?ArticleID=136255|title=Osama bin Laden's family, parenting exposed in son's book|date=2010-01-06|author=Donna Abu-Nasr}}{{cite web|url=http://www.syracuse.com/news/index.ssf/2010/01/son_of_osama_bin_laden_describ.html|title=Son of Osama bin Laden describes brutal childhood|publisher=Associated Press|date=2010-01-10}}''Growing Up Bin Laden:Osama's Wife and Son Take Us Inside Their Secret World'', [[Jean Sasson]], Omar bin Laden, and Najwa bin Laden (St. Martin's Press) 2009. {{ISBN|978-0-312-56016-4}}, {{ISBN|0-312-56016-8}} ===Death of his father=== {{Further information|Death of Osama bin Laden}} Bin Laden published a complaint on May 10, 2011, that the [[Death of Osama bin Laden#Burial at sea|burial at sea]] of his father [[Osama bin Laden|Osama]] deprived the family of a proper burial. He made several other claims regarding the mission that killed his father, such as stating that no one living at the compound was armed; {{Citation needed|date=September 2015}} he also requested that the UN and other international groups investigate the killing of Osama as a criminal matter.[https://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/11/world/asia/binladen-statement.html "Statement From the Family of Osama bin Laden"]. ''[[The New York Times]]]''. May 10, 2011. His requests were ignored by the U.S. and no actions based on them have been taken so far.{{fact|date=November 2017}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== * [http://www.newstatesman.com/middle-east/2009/11/bin-laden-father-life-believe Omar Bin Laden Interview - Published 19 November 2009] {{Osama bin Laden}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bin Laden, Omar}} [[Category:Bin Laden family|Omar]] [[Category:1981 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Osama bin Laden]] [[Category:Saudi Arabian people of Syrian descent]] [[Category:Saudi Arabian businesspeople]]
